Description: Flint blade, steep retouch at distal end, possibly used as a scraper.
Curator's comments: One of six flint ‘flakes’ found in a cooking pot together with domestic debris including ashes, twigs, animal bones, and potsherds (see EA 62228-32).
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 16)
Exhibition history: 2019-2023, Oxford, Ashmolean Museum of Art & Archaeology, Loan for study: prehistoric Egyptian (Badrian) lithic artefacts
